datasetContactName.value: ASC Academic Publishing, Minden, Nevada, USA

dsDescriptionValue.value: This description is about a new 256-bit block symmetric substitution-permutation cipher, called a managed substitution cipher. This is a cipher with single-layer permutated transformations in each cycle. The management of substituted transformations occur by including them in a chain so that the output value of the previous SL transform is fed to the input of the current fortified 32-bit substituted transformation (SL conversion) along with the current value of the input data block through the adder for modulo 2. This allows you to activate almost all S-blocks of the second cycle and subsequent cycles and eventually improve the dynamic indicators of the arrival of the cipher to the state of random substitution. The results of the evaluation of indicators of randomness and the possibility of using random S-blocks. It is shown that such construction of cycled function allows to use random substitutions without any selection in a cipher while not reducing its strength.

keywordValue.value: controlled enlarged S-blocks; dynamic cipher indicators; active S-blocks; random S-blocks; indicators of randomness; indicators of strength; pipeline processing.
